content.text:
For extra context: I'd like to run a pub in my co-working space so that others on my WLAN have a direct connection to the #scuttleverse without actually having to sign up anywhere.

The problem is that I'd _also_ like to give out invites to others on #scuttlebutt (because running a pub sounds interesting/fun), but I don't think I can give out a working link unless I:

1. Deploy a server to Digital Ocean or something (bad, I want it to exist locally), or
2. Use a service like https://noip.com (not great, at the mercy of a for-profit), or
3. Require that remote users install something like Tor, I2P, IPFS, Dat, or whatever (eh, not user-friendly)

Can anyone suggest a non-awful way to do this? I'm sure I'm not the first person to consider doing this and I'm trying to avoid reinventing the wheel.
